meanings.definition: To suppose that something is true without having evidence to confirm it.
meanings.sent1: I presume the sun will rise tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She presumes he will be late as usual.
meanings.sent3: Don't presume the cat will like the new food just because it smells good.
meanings.sent4: He presumed her silence meant she agreed, but he was mistaken.
meanings.sent5: Presuming the package will arrive on time, she made plans for the party.

meanings.definition: To take for granted or assume something to be true.
meanings.sent1: We presume the store will be open until 9 pm.
meanings.sent2: He presumes his parents will support his decision.
meanings.sent3: I presume the cookies will disappear as soon as I leave the room.
meanings.sent4: She presumed his smile meant he was happy, but he was actually nervous.
meanings.sent5: Presuming the bus will be late, she decided to walk instead.

meanings.definition: To act or proceed with unwarrantable boldness.
meanings.sent1: He presumes to speak on behalf of the entire group.
meanings.sent2: She presumes to know more than the experts.
meanings.sent3: The cat presumes to steal food from the dog's bowl.
meanings.sent4: The young boy presumes to challenge the champion chess player.
meanings.sent5: Presuming to be the leader, he made decisions without consulting the team.
